To Master Samuell Jeake in Rye

[86] Bernard Coudert to Samuel Jeake junior, 6 May 1679. Original letter. ESRO FRE 4890

Samuel Jeake Junior Nants, May 6" 1679 Sir Iam Honoured with yours of the 19" March wherein I Doe obsarve By the Recommendation of Mr Claude Hays of London you are pleased to apply your selfe unto mee for your correspondant. In answer I doe acknowl- idge my selfe oblidged unto Mr Hays for his kindness to Procure me your acquaintance when occasion shall present on the parts to sarve you may be assured of my Readyness with all the care & punctualitie that can be expected. In doeing my best Endeavour for Promotteing your Intrest as my owne. Our Brandys are this day sould att 45 Ib 10s [words illegible] whitte from 80 to 85 Ib the tyn, Best High country claretts from 88 to 100 lb the ton, [words lost] 95 Ib Nante wines from 36 to 45 lb, Black Borneef Salt 20 lb. The charge croisie & Pouliquer 18 1b. the [word illegible]. If you order me to Loade any Goods for your account may bee pleased to remitte mee the Provision Bills upon Paris. If nott [word lost] order somes eminent freinds in London to accept my bills for your account. I [do] nott know what manifactures you have in your Parts that I may advise you as for Lead is att 30 [word illegible] the 100/00 Suffolk Butter 241b the gall. I doe kindely value you & as for my commission I tacke 2 % per %

Sir Yours att Command

Bernard Coudert

I have forgotten to tell you that your letter dated of the 19" March I did receave it onely this day By addresse of Mr L’-homme of Paris have a care of

him for his Business were nott curr[en]t a whille ago. This for your Government.

To Mr Samuel Jeake Junior Merchand in Rye via London
